definition:
Let $X$ be a , and $G$ its associated topological group, that is, such
that an action $a$ of $G$ on $X$ is continuous if $a : G \times X \to X$
is continuous. If $G$ is a Polish group and $X$ is also a Polish space,
then $X$ is called a *Polish G-space*.

[9]{} Howard Becker, Alexander S. Kechris. 1996. *The Descriptive Set
Theory of Polish Group Actions* Cambridge University Press: Cambridge,
UK, p.14.
